properties.areaDesc: Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains; North Laramie Range; Converse County Lower Elevations; Shirley Basin
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 2 at 2:37PM MST until February 4 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH
MONDAY FOR EAST CENTRAL THROUGH SOUTH CENTRAL WYOMING...

* WHAT...Snow and periods of freezing drizzle expected. Snow may
be heavy at times Sunday night. Total snow accumulations of 5
to 10 inches in the valleys and high plains, with 10 to 20
inches above 8000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Central and east central Wyoming, including Douglas,
Bill, Muddy Gap, and the northern Laramie Range.

* WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility in the mountains. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute. The cold wind chills as low as 10 below zero could
cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 40 minutes.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY
